intro: Scabiosa crubita, commonly known as the lesser scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a soft, velvety texture. Scabiosa crubita is native to Europe and is often found in grasslands, meadows, and woodland edges.
